sources.comment_example: Engineer visited the site and replaced the faulty DIMM module in Processor 1 Slot 8. System tested and confirmed working fine after replacement.
DIMM failure
Part replaced successfully. Customer confirmed system stable.
Server experiencing memory errors and system instability due to faulty DIMM module in Processor 1 Slot 8

DIMM and BIOS health degraded

Engineer visited the site and replaced the faulty DIMM module in Processor 1 Slot 8. System tested and confirmed working fine.
Hardware failure - Defective DIMM
[Critical] HPE ProLiant DL380 Gen10 - Memory Health Degraded
Plan of Action

Issue description: Server Memory Health Degraded
Action Plan: Need to Replace the DIMM
Part needed: Yes
- Part Number - 815098-B21
- Part Description - 32GB DDR4-2666 Memory Module
Customer wishes CSR for: Yes
Plan of Action - Onsite
Happycall/HW;YES;CSC;YES;YES;DIMM replacement
Visited customer site. Identified faulty DIMM in Proc1 Slot 8 using iLO diagnostics. Replaced DIMM module part# 815098-B21. Ran memory diagnostics - all tests passed. Server health verified as good.
Fault - Faulty DIMM in Processor 1 Slot 8
Engineer confirmed on site. Working on DIMM replacement. Replacement completed successfully. All diagnostics passed. Customer confirmed system stable.
support.hpe.com
Partner Notes 20251009, CE: John Issue: HPE ProLiant DL380 Gen10 Server Memory Status Degraded Action: Replace DIMM, 815098-B21, SN New: SNEW123456, SN Old: SOLD789012
RE: HPE Support Case 5000123456 [ ref:!00Dd00bUlK.!500Kh0fwcXA:ref ]

Dear Customer, Your case 5000123456 has been updated. Engineer has completed the DIMM replacement successfully. Please verify system stability and confirm if issue is resolved. Thank you for choosing Hewlett Packard Enterprise. Sincerely, HPE Support Team

HPE StoreEver MSL6480 Tape Library - Tape drive in slot 4 hardware failure

Advanced replacement approved. Shipping tape drive part# BH965A. Customer received replacement drive. Installation in progress. Drive installed and initialized. Library recognizes new drive. Test backup job successful.

Dear Customer, Your replacement LTO-8 tape drive has been shipped via express delivery. Tracking number: XYZ789456. Expected delivery tomorrow. Installation guide attached. Please confirm once installed and tested. Regards, HPE Support
Engineer visited site and replaced the failing hard drive. RAID array rebuild initiated and completed successfully. Array status now optimal.
HDD failure
Order Converted to S4. Part replaced. RAID rebuild completed.
Server showing storage controller warnings. One of the hard drives in RAID array showing excessive media errors and predicted failure.

Model: DL360 Gen9 OS: Windows Server 2019
Hard drive showing predictive failure warning - SMART errors detected
Product Non-functional/Not working as Expected

Defective HDD replaced

RAID rebuild completed successfully
Onsite Repair
Engineer visited site and replaced the failing hard drive. RAID array rebuild initiated and completed successfully. Array status now optimal.
Hardware failure - Hard drive media errors
[Urgent] DL360 Gen9 - Hard Drive Predictive Failure Alert
Plan of Action

Issue description: Hard Drive Predictive Failure
Action Plan: Replace failing HDD before complete failure
Part needed: Yes
- Part Number - 872479-B21
- Part Description - 1TB SATA 7.2K LFF HDD
Customer wishes CSR for: No
RAID rebuild will be required post replacement
Plan of Action - Onsite
Happycall/HW;YES;CSC;YES;YES;disk replacement

Check the case log and contact the customer collect the log. The log shows a 1TB hard disk has error count. AHS log analyzed to identify the location of the failed disk in bay 3. Replaced disk and initiated RAID rebuild. Rebuild completed in 4 hours. Array status verified as optimal.
Fault - Hard drive predictive failure in bay 3

iLO logs show SMART errors on drive in bay 3 for the past week. AHS logs uploaded and analyzed. Drive showing high error count. Part 872479-B21 available in local depot. Engineer dispatch scheduled. Engineer on site. Drive replacement in progress. Drive replaced. RAID rebuild at 50% completion. RAID rebuild completed. Array status optimal. Customer confirmed no issues.
Partner Notes 20251010, CE: Mike Issue: HPE ProLiant DL360 Gen9 Server HDD Predictive Failure Action: Replace HDD, 872479-B21, SN New: S4567890, SN Old: S1234567, RAID rebuild initiated
RE: HPE Support Case 5000345678 - HDD Failure [ ref:!00Dd00bUlK.!500Kh0fABCD:ref ]

Dear Customer, Your HDD replacement has been completed. RAID rebuild is in progress and currently at 75% completion. Expected completion in 1 hour. We will monitor the rebuild process. Please do not power off the server during rebuild. Regards, HPE Support
Customer implemented certain planned changes as part of activity CHG0169095, which triggered the related alerts. After the completion of the planned activity, the storage state returned to normal.

Customer implemented certain planned changes as part of activity CHG0169095, which triggered the related alerts. After the completion of the planned activity, the storage state returned to normal. Customer confirmed that the issue is resolved and requested to close the case.
False alarm - Planned maintenance activity
[Auto Alert] HPE 3PAR StoreServ A630 - Storage Threshold Warning
Trouble Shooting
Informed the customer that we will check with the extended diagnostics team for further investigation and provide an update. Customer mentioned planned maintenance was in progress.
Troubleshooting
False alarm;Planned maintenance;No action required
Remote investigation completed. Confirmed alert triggered during planned maintenance window CHG0169095. Storage system operating normally post-maintenance.
HPE 3PAR StoreServ A630 - False alarm during maintenance

Auto-generated alert received from 3PAR system at 02:15 AM. Customer contacted - confirmed planned maintenance was scheduled for 02:00-04:00 AM window. Storage logs reviewed. Alert coincides with maintenance activity CHG0169095. Post-maintenance verification shows all storage metrics within normal parameters. Customer confirmed system operating normally. Requested case closure.
urldefense.com
Remote monitoring alert - False positive identified. Maintenance window CHG0169095 confirmed. No actual storage issue present. System health verified as optimal post-maintenance.
RE: HPE Support Case 5000456789 - 3PAR Alert [ ref:!00Dd00bUlK.!500Kh0fEFGH:ref ]

Dear Customer, We have completed investigation of the 3PAR alert. The alert was triggered during your planned maintenance window CHG0169095. All storage metrics are now within normal parameters. This was a false alarm. No further action required. Case will be closed. Regards, HPE Support
